item.title: A note on Skew Brownian Motion with two-valued drift and an application
item.description: arXiv:2407.09321v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: For skew Brownian motion with two-valued drift, adopting a perturbation approach we find expressions of its potential densities. As applications, we recover its transition density and study its long-time asymptotic behaviors. We also compare with previous results on transition densities for skew Brownian motions. We propose two approaches for generating quasi-random samples by approximating the cumulative distribution function and discussing their risk measurement application.
item.dc:creator: Zaniar Ahmadi, Xiaowen Zhou

item.title: Dispensing with optimal control: a new approach for the pricing and management of share buyback contracts
item.description: arXiv:2404.13754v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: This paper introduces a novel methodology for the pricing and management of share buyback contracts, overcoming the limitations of traditional optimal control methods, which frequently encounter difficulties with high-dimensional state spaces and the intricacies of selecting appropriate risk penalty or risk aversion parameter. Our methodology applies optimized heuristic strategies to maximize the contract's value. The computation of this value utilizes classical methods typically used for pricing path-dependent options. Additionally, our approach naturally leads to the formulation of a $\Delta$-hedging strategy and disentangles therefore the repurchase strategy from the hedging of the payoff.
item.dc:creator: Bastien Baldacci, Philippe Bergault, Olivier Gu\'eant
